subject: Re: [junit] Ant's  using class name and not test name in XML report
msgSnippet: ... It looks like the XML formatter is making an assumption about the TestSuite name. I m not sure what to do about that, short of looking at the source and
messageBody:
Charles Fineman wrote:

> Now... I have a TestSuite that takes the name of a script as a
> parameter. That script contains a series of request/response pairs. I
> dynamically generate a test case for each line in the file and add it
> to the TestSuite. The name of the TestSuite is the name of the script
> file so I can distinguish between runs.
>
> I run this insisde Eclipse and the TestSuite's name is correct (i.e.
> it's the name of the script) but when I run it using ant with an XML
> formatter, the name of the test is the name of the class.

It looks like the XML formatter is making an assumption about the
TestSuite name. I'm not sure what to do about that, short of looking at
the source and deciding it's incorrect. I think that, objectively
speaking, a TestSuite should be named by its name property, and not
necessarily its class name.

Look at the Ant task source and see what you can find out. I doubt it
would be a difficult fix. TestSuite has a method to return the name, so
perhaps the XML formatter is not invoking it.

> For the time being I'm going to create a second TestSuite under the
> main test suite and give it the correct name since all the children of
> the original have synthetic names and show up find in the generated XML.
>
> Is this a known issue? Better workarounds than what i've mentioned above?

I've never run into it before. I don't name test suites very often, and
I've been working mostly in Eclipse for the past two years. :)
